content.question: A particle moves in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane so that its position at time <math alttext="t is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="x of t, equals, 2 times the natural log of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>‚Å°</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the fraction with numerator 4, and denominator t plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>. What is the speed of the particle when <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> ?
